channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: X’s crowd-sourced ‘Community Notes’ fact checks fail to address flood of U.S. election misinformation, report says
item.description: The nonprofit Center for Countering Digital Hate found that accurate notes correcting false and misleading claims about the elections were not display...

item.title: In China, Comedy Is Giving Women a Voice. But Can Men Take a Joke?
item.description: Comedy has become a way for women to skewer China’s gender inequality. Some men aren’t happy about it.

item.title: Donald and Melania Trump Were Made for Each Other
item.description: The former first lady’s new book shows that she still doesn’t care.

item.title: Inflation Is Basically Back to Normal. Why Do Voters Still Feel Blah?
item.description: Consumers still give the economy poor marks, though the job market is strong and price increases have faded for months.

item.title: After the Flash Floods in Spain, Rescuers and Residents Face a Grim Scene
item.description: At least 95 people have died, and others are still missing, though how many remains unclear. Rescuers feared finding more bodies, the defense minister...

item.title: Top U.S. Officials Head to Middle East to Try to Jumpstart Cease-Fire Talks
item.description: William Burns, the C.I.A. director, is making a last-ditch attempt to move Gaza talks along before U.S. elections next week.

item.title: Once Europe’s North Korea—Albania is now a rising star of the region’s medical tourism industry
item.description: Albania lures millions of tourists a year, with a growing portion coming in search of a radiant smile, luscious lips or better breasts.

item.title: Russia’s Swift March Forward in Ukraine’s East
item.description: Russia gained more territory in Ukraine in October than in any other month in the past two years.

item.title: Washington Post has lost over 250,000 subscribers since Jeff Bezos decided not to run a presidential endorsement
item.description: The Post's owner, Jeff Bezos, said presidential endorsements create a perception of bias at the newspaper while having little real influence on how re...

item.title: Lake Tahoe voters may hit vacation homes with a $3,000 tax as 44% of housing units are vacant most of the time
item.description: The tax would increase to $6,000 for every subsequent year the home remains empty for half the year.

item.title: Exclusive: Richemont will automate a part of its hiring process across brands like Cartier and Van Cleef & Arpels
item.description: Richemont will partner with California-based Veritone, to use AI and sift through scores of candidates looking to be hired by the company.

item.title: Biden’s Stake in This Election Is Like Nobody Else’s
item.description: Will he be remembered as American democracy’s savior — or as a midwife to its ruin?

item.title: After Flash Floods in Spain, Rescuers and Residents Face a Grim Scene
item.description: At least 95 people have died, and others are still missing, though how many remains unclear. Rescuers feared finding more bodies, the defense minister...

item.title: In Georgia, Harris Supporters Pull Together and Fight the Odds
item.description: It’s not easy being a dot of blue in Trump country.

item.title: Music and Morale in a Country at War
item.description: In Ukraine, where war feels omnipresent, music is helping lift spirits and raise money for the military.
